page.title: 02PILSLEY EMPLOYMENT - MINING
page.content:
A survey of the employment of the fathers of the children at Pilsley Primary School showed that 24% work for the National Coal Board in the mining industry in jobs ranging from coal-face workers to colliery technicians and engineers. Formerly the N.C.B. employed a larger percentage of Pilsley men when the local colliery was working, but it has now been closed for some years.
The N.C.B. workers are now spread amongst eight collieries, two N.C.B. workshops & plant maintenance depots, and the National Smokeless Fuel Plant.
The majority of Pilsley miners work at the Silverhill, Markham and Arkwright collieries.
